Header: Iraqi parliament passes resolution to end foreign troop presence
Content: The Iraqi parliament called on the government to work to end all foreign troop presence as a backlash grew after the killing of a top Iranian military commander and an Iraqi militia leader in a U.S. strike in Baghdad. A resolution passed by a special session of parliament said the government should cancel its request for assistance from a U.S.-led coalition. Parliament resolutions, unlike laws, are non-binding to the government. But this one is likely to be heeded. Meanwhile, President Trump has threatened severe sanctions against Iraq after its parliament called on US troops to leave the country. UPSOUND
